stimulusHtml: All of the following statements are factually accurate. Which describes the most serious limitation of the data showing only a small increase in sugar consumption by continental Europe in the period from 1750 to 1800 ?

features.html:
CONSUMPTION OF SUGAR PER PERSON PER YEAR (in pounds)

  Europe (Continental Europe and Great Britain) Continental Europe Britain Only
1680 1.0 .85 4
1750 2.2 1.90 10
1800 2.6 1.98 18

 

Source: Kenneth Pomeranz, historian, The Great Divergence, 2000

choicesHtml: In 1800, the British navy was blockading French-controlled ports and seriously interfering with the overseas trade of Revolutionary France and its allies.
By 1800, methods of extracting sugar from sugarcane had become much more efficient as a result of the development of new technologies.
In 1800, sugar did not account for the majority of calories consumed by people in Britain or continental Europe.
By 1800, merchant ships of all continental European countries were involved in the sugar trade.
